title: Biden Picks Denver Airport Chief to Lead Federal Aviation Administration; If confirmed by the U.S. Senate, Phil Washington would lead the air-safety regulator as it faces challenges with travel disruptions, safety oversight
text:
Mr. Washington couldn't immediately be reached for comment on Wednesday.

If confirmed by the Senate to run the FAA, Mr. Washington would confront multiple challenges, including recent widespread air-traffic disruptions as airlines struggle to meet surging demand for flights, and improving the agency's oversight of aviation safety after two Boeing 737 MAX crashes in 2018 and 2019.

Write to Micah Maidenberg at micah.maidenberg@wsj.com and Andrew Tangel at Andrew.Tangel@wsj.com

Biden Picks Denver Airport Chief to Lead Federal Aviation Administration
